Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP server using Netty framework to handle client connections and manage heartbeat detection.

Class Description: The HeartbeatServer class is a Netty-based TCP server that listens for incoming connections on a specified port, manages client connections using boss and worker event loop groups, and includes proper startup and shutdown procedures.

Attributes:
- PORT: [static final int] - The port number on which the server will listen for connections
- bossGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - The parent event loop group that accepts incoming connections
- workerGroup: [EventLoopGroup] - The child event loop group that handles the traffic of accepted connections
- bootstrap: [ServerBootstrap] - The server configuration object that binds the server components together

Methods:
- HeartbeatServer() -> [constructor] - Initializes the server components including event loop groups and server bootstrap
- start() throws Exception -> [void] - Configures and starts the server, binds to the specified port, and begins accepting connections
- stop() -> [void] - Shuts down the server gracefully by closing all event loop groups
